the vertical component \(\nu_{\mathrm{y}}\) of the velocity (label this line Y),
the horizontal component \(\nu_{\mathrm{x}}\) of the velocity (label this line X)

maximum height = .........m

kinetic energy at maximum height
change in gravitational potential energy

A uniform beam AB of length 6.0m is placed on a horizontal surface and then tilted at an angle of \(31^{\circ}\) to the horizontal, as shown in Fig. 2.1

The beam is held in equilibrium by four forces that all act in the same plane. A force of 90N acts perpendicular to the beam at end A. The weight \(W\) of the beam acts at its centre of gravity. A vertical force \(Y\) and a horizontal force \(X\) both act at end B of the beam

2. the force exerted on this mass of air by the propeller
